t: Matthew 11
Jesus and John the Baptist
After*p Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and preach in the towns of Galilee.
When*p John, who was in prison, heard about the deeds of the Messiah, he sent his disciples
to ask him, “Are you the one who is to come, or should we expect someone else?”
Jesus*p replied, “Go*r back*r and*r report*r to*r John*r what*r you*r hear*r and*r see:*r

The*r blind*r receive*r sight,*r the*r lame*r walk,*r those*r who*r have*r leprosy*r are*r cleansed,*r the*r deaf*r hear,*r the*r dead*r are*r raised,*r and*r the*r good*r news*r is*r proclaimed*r to*r the*r poor.*r
Blessed*r is*r anyone*r who*r does*r not*r stumble*r on*r account*r of*r me.”*r
As*p John’s disciples were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: “What*r did*r you*r go*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r swayed*r by*r the*r wind?*r
If*r not,*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r dressed*r in*r fine*r clothes?*r No,*r those*r who*r wear*r fine*r clothes*r are*r in*r kings’*r palaces.*r
Then*r what*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yes,*r I*r tell*r you,*r and*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
This*r is*r the*r one*r about*r whom*r it*r is*r written:*r “ ‘I*rpn will*r send*r my*r messenger*r ahead*r of*r you,*r who*rld will*r prepare*r your*r way*r before*r you.’*r

Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r among*r those*r born*r of*r women*r there*r has*r not*r risen*r anyone*r greater*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist;*r yet*r whoever*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r greater*r than*r he.*r
From*r the*r days*r of*r John*r the*r Baptist*r until*r now,*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r has*r been*r subjected*r to*r violence,*r and*r violent*r people*r have*r been*r raiding*r it.*r
For*r all*r the*r Prophets*r and*r the*r Law*r prophesied*r until*r John.*r
And*r if*r you*r are*r willing*r to*r accept*r it,*r he*r is*r the*r Elijah*r who*r was*r to*r come.*r
Whoever*r has*r ears,*r let*r them*r hear.*r
“To*rp what*r can*r I*r compare*r this*r generation?*r They*r are*r like*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r marketplaces*r and*r calling*r out*r to*r others:*r
“ ‘We*rpn played*r the*r pipe*r for*r you,*r and*rld you*r did*r not*r dance;*r we*rln sang*r a*r dirge,*r and*rld you*r did*r not*r mourn.’*r
For*rp John*r came*r neither*r eating*r nor*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘He*r has*r a*r demon.’*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r came*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘Here*r is*r a*r glutton*r and*r a*r drunkard,*r a*r friend*r of*r tax*r collectors*r and*r sinners.’*r But*r wisdom*r is*r proved*r right*r by*r her*r deeds.”*r
Woe on Unrepentant Towns
Then*p Jesus began to denounce the towns in which most of his miracles had been performed, because they did not repent.

“Woe*r to*r you,*r Chorazin!*r Woe*r to*r you,*r Bethsaida!*r For*r if*r the*r miracles*r that*r were*r performed*r in*r you*r had*r been*r performed*r in*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon,*r they*r would*r have*r repented*r long*r ago*r in*r sackcloth*r and*r ashes.*r
But*r I*r tell*r you,*r it*r will*r be*r more*r bearable*r for*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon*r on*r the*r day*r of*r judgment*r than*r for*r you.*r

And*r you,*r Capernaum,*r will*r you*r be*r lifted*r to*r the*r heavens?*r No,*r you*r will*r go*r down*r to*r Hades.*r For*r if*r the*r miracles*r that*r were*r performed*r in*r you*r had*r been*r performed*r in*r Sodom,*r it*r would*r have*r remained*r to*r this*r day.*r
But*r I*r tell*r you*r that*r it*r will*r be*r more*r bearable*r for*r Sodom*r on*r the*r day*r of*r judgment*r than*r for*r you.”*r
The Father Revealed in the Son

At*p that time Jesus said, “I*r praise*r you,*r Father,*r Lord*r of*r heaven*r and*r earth,*r because*r you*r have*r hidden*r these*r things*r from*r the*r wise*r and*r learned,*r and*r revealed*r them*r to*r little*r children.*r
Yes,*r Father,*r for*r this*r is*r what*r you*r were*r pleased*r to*r do.*r

“All*rp things*r have*r been*r committed*r to*r me*r by*r my*r Father.*r No*r one*r knows*r the*r Son*r except*r the*r Father,*r and*r no*r one*r knows*r the*r Father*r except*r the*r Son*r and*r those*r to*r whom*r the*r Son*r chooses*r to*r reveal*r him.*r
“Come*rp to*r me,*r all*r you*r who*r are*r weary*r and*r burdened,*r and*r I*r will*r give*r you*r rest.*r
Take*r my*r yoke*r upon*r you*r and*r learn*r from*r me,*r for*r I*r am*r gentle*r and*r humble*r in*r heart,*r and*r you*r will*r find*r rest*r for*r your*r souls.*r
